page.title: 10FARMING AROUND PROBUS
page.content: {Farming around Probus} Most of this area is farmland,with farms mainly consisting of 200 acres or more.The smaller farms are being put out of business by the larger ones Three farms are taken as examples.The smallest has 200 acres of mixed farm land,which has been in the same family for about 50 years.Three workers are employed & they concentrate on beef, with about 50 cattle,& lamb,with about 200 sheep.About 20 acres are for silage,40 acres for hay & about acres for straw,so the farm is generally self-sufficient.The silage is dealt with by a contractor to save buying special machinery.The cattle and sheep are either sold in Truro market or go to the abbatoir at Probus.
